doc.after: Loss of power weakened Heath s control over the party and Margaret Thatcher deposed him in the 1975 leadership election The UK in the 1970s had seen sustained high inflation rates which were above 20 at the time of the leadership election subsequently falling to below 10 unemployment had risen and over the winter of 1978 79 there was a series of strikes known as the Winter of Discontent 32 Thatcher led her party to victory in the 1979 general election with a manifesto which concentrated on the party s philosophy rather than presenting a shopping list of policies 33
